A oes am y traffig? Do you think that was used more then than it is now?

Oh, yes. Well of course people didn't. There was very few people at cars in those days.

Now at one time the church and the chapels were very important.

Was the power of the church and the chapel declining when you first came to Shotten, do you think?
Oh yes, I would think it was, yeah.
Did it still have some influence?
It still had some influence, but not the influence.
When you had families, you got families with the thing.
I used to go to a little Welsh church at the top of Cessrian Street in Cyneski.
Zion. And of course all the, I suppose you know what it is, there would be a membership in the morning service, it would be about 40 or 50.
At night it would be probably about 100, 120.
And all this was in families. You used to get pews when all the families used to sit them up and father and the children.
And actually they grew up, sort of.
But of course as the years went on, it got less and less and less. The family influence disappeared.
And that was it. When the children grew up, they didn't go to church any more.
And there was a very friendly atmosphere in the chapel, wasn't there?
Oh yeah, yes.
Yes, you could go to the, everyone was always, in a Welsh chapel either called uncle or auntie, it was always the sort of thing, you know.
And you used to get nicknames, Mr Evans used to have a coal machine, you'd call Evans the coal,
Pritchard de Groos, and Harry Price the butcher.
They always had whatever they were doing after their name, sort of thing, you know. This is the difference.
Did the minister have an important role in those days, do you think?
Oh yes, he had quite an important role, you know.
Of course you used to get the minister used to come around and say his flockers used to come around, you know, pretty well every week.
And different functions, you know, I mean, if you ever had a christening, burials and so forth.
And then the other thing, they used to take quite a lot of interest in most of the sporting things and all that sort of thing, especially in the church side of it, you know.
You used to have a football club at the church and so forth.
And a minister used to be classed as a real family friend in times of trouble, and so if you were ever in any kind of trouble or you wanted any advice, he was the first person you went to see.
I suppose that this sort of thing goes to Damo, well that's not in such a way, because you don't get the same amount of people going to church.
Do you think that the church or the chapel was particularly strong, or were they both about the same?
They were both about the same. I would think the biggest thing about, the biggest change of all would be the RC Church, the Roman Catholic Church.
They must have, when we first came here, there was very, well I'm not saying very few, but there wasn't a lot of people, but it's changed completely.
I mean, you can go to the Catholic Church now and it's full to overflowing on a Sunday morning.
They've opened a church at Queens Valley, they've got one in Hardin.
And this is where I think that's where the big impact has come.
People have tended to have gone away from the Church of England and the non-conformist church,
but the Catholic Church in turn seems to be getting stronger.
You mentioned that boys and girls used to meet on a Sunday evening.
Well of course, you see, boys and girls used to go to church and the cinemas weren't allowed on a Sunday, no, there was no cinemas.
And the only thing left to do was to walk along from Shotton to Queens Ferry, which used to call the Monkey Walk.
And at Queens Ferry there was this milk bar and it was boys and girls used to walk up and down there and they used to meet and perhaps start cold ships, even in the end get married.
But that's where they used to meet. One used to see hundreds and hundreds of boys and girls going up and down the Ferry Road along, well we used to call it the Monkey Walk.
What other popular means of entertainment, Mylr?

We had Shotton Athletic which played down here.
There was an awful lot of emphasis on clubs and snooker and billiards, that was another big thing.

But those were the things, there was a little place up here called the Institute where Woolworths is now.

An awful lot of cards played as well, they used to have a proper room where a fella used to go in and play cards, probably for money, a crib and one thing or the other.
And of course the cinema was very popular as well.

Rwy'n meddwl bod yn cael llawer o ffyrdd, mae'r ffyrdd wedi'i cael y ffyrdd yn oed yn fwy o ffordd.
Rwy'n meddwl bod'r ffyrdd wedi'i cael y ffyrdd yn oed yn fwy o ffordd gydag yma hefyd.
Ond nid yw'r hynny'n cael y ffyrdd,'r cyfnod,'r swyddiad, ac fe ddod yn cael ei gael a'i gael y gwaith,
a'r ffyrdd yn cael so mwy o ffyrdd o'r gwaith a'i gael gael ar gyfer y gwasanaeth yma.
A oedd hynny'n cael unrhyw ddod o'r ffyrdd?
Ond wrth gwrs, rydym yn cael unrhyw ddod o'r ffyrdd o'r gwasanaeth yma.
Yn ystod ymlaen am ymlaen, rydym yn cael unrhyw ddod o'r ffyrdd,
yn y ffordd y gallai'r ddodau fel gans.
Rydwch chi'n cael y pethau ysbrydol.
Rydyn ni'n cael y pethau ysbrydol, mae'r Amherkin yn mynd i'w llunio a'i ddod yn y gwasanaeth yma,
a'i ddod yn y gwasanaeth, fel y gallai'r ddod yn y gwasanaeth.
A yna rydych chi'n cael y ddod Angles, rydych chi'n cael y ddod Polis, rydych chi'n cael
bob amser o ddodau, bob amser o ddodau.
A'i ddod yn y gwasanaeth a'i ddod, a byddai'n cael hynny.
Mae'n cael hynny heddiw.
Ond mae'r ffrindiau yn cael eu gysylltu'n fawr iawn.
Felly byddai ddodau ddod yn y ffordd neu beth o'r ffordd?
Nid yw'n rhai, nid.
Mae'r un o'r ddiforolion yn cael ei ddod, ond rwy'n credu ei fod yn gallu ei wneud i'r ffactorau
y gallai'n cael tro amser i ddod.
A oedd y cyfle i'r pubs wedi'i gweithio'n oed yn y ffordd hefyd?
O, mae'n rhaid i bobl, bobl yn cael eu gweithio i'r pubs yn fawr.
Ond wrth gwrs, mae'r pwmpen yn cael eu gweithio i'r pubs, ond nid oedd yn cael ei gweithio'n oed.
A oedd un o'r pwmpen yn cael ei gweithio'n oed yn fawr.
Wel, yn ffordd, fel y ffactorau, rwy'n credu bod yn rhan o'r ffactorau yn cael ei gweithio'n oed i'r pubs,
oherwydd roedd hi'n cael ei wneud i'w gweithio, a'i gweithio'n oed yn oed yn oed yn oed.
Oherwydd os oedd yn cael ei gweithio ar gyfer gafur, efallai ei gweithio ar gyfer gafur yna, oherwydd yna,
yw'r pethau yma sy'n cael ei wneud.
A beth o'r effeithiau y mae'r gweithiad ar gyfer gafur i'w gweithio?
Wel, rwy'n credu bod pobl ar gyfer gafur yn cael ei gweithio'n oed yn fwy oherwydd,
y byddwn yn ymwneud â hynny'n bwysig, rydyn ni'n mynd i'w wneud y mwyaf o'r gafur.
A dyma'r pethau y mae'n cael i'w gwybod gyda phobl iawn,
maen nhw'n eich bod yn eich gafur, maen nhw'n eich bod yn eich gafur,
a'r hyn yn gwybod bod yna yw'r pethau yma.
Byddai, y ganolad tro,
fe gellis y gafur a godi fod e'n dod fel newydd a f birl� performances yn fan toryn.
которогоeth y 귀 mod i ffordd.
Roedd yn an embarrassed fish a phwy nach,
ar hyn o'r back� mae'n hollol,
felly ganddiol hyn, ry'n enwi bod droswg,
chynno atystaled o sos,
I'r hyn yw'r peth, dwi'n credu.
Yn ystod y peth rydych chi'n dweud y gwaith mwyaf yn ymwybyddol yng Nghymru yn ym Mhobl?
Rwy'n credu bod un o'r pethau mwyaf yn ymwybyddol yw'r ffaith y bydd ynghylch o ran y cyfnod hwn.
Mae gennym unrhyw fath o bobl yn ymwybyddol yma.
Mae'n bwysig iawn i'r ffaith yma, rwy'n credu.
Y ffaith yw, roedd y bobl yn dweud y byddai'n gweithio ar hyn o ddau.
Felly dydwch chi'n credu bod y pethau'n gweithio ar y ffaith?
Dwi ddim yn credu.
Rwy'n credu bod yn unrhyw fath o'r ffaith.
Rwy'n credu, rwy'n oed o'r generiaeth ymlaen, a'n cael ei ddweud, rwy'n cael ei ddweud, rwy'n cael atydiadau gwahanol.
Rwy'n cael atydiadau gwahanol i fy ffrindiau yn y llun.
Mae'n rhaid i ni ddod o'r ffaith, mae'n cael gael gydol yn unig, a dyna y pethau'n gwahanol.
Diolch yn fawr.
